featured.text: A typical room of a capsule hotel is roughly the length and width of a single bed, with sufficient height for a guest to crawl in and sit up on the bed.
By the way, is your house guest still staying with you?
The word “prom” was first used in the 1890s, referring to formal dances in which the guests of a party would display their fashions and dancing skills during the evening’s grand march.
The adapted rides include the Off-Road Adventure, where guests can test their driving skills in sporty vehicles.
One evening a guest in the dining hall felt that his potatoes were too thick and sent them back to the kitchen.

other.text: He was so happy with them that other guests started ordering the new potatoes.
He enclosed thank- you notes in the cookies and served them to his guests with tea.
By this time the cook was angry and decided to do exactly what the dinner guest wanted: slice the potatoes as thin as possible.
They were prized possessions made of expensive materials intended to impress guests.
Guests have to crawl into bed through a large porthole entrance.
The room’s thin plastic walls easily transmit the sound of snoring made by neighboring guests.
Guests may enjoy facilities such as free Wi-Fi, mobile charging, and even a soundless alarm system that raises the sleeping guests into a seated position while gradually brightening the lights.
Also, you may have to share common facilities (such as bathrooms) with other guests.
The cook’s plan to stop the dinner guest from complaining did not turn out as he had planned.
__(18)__ a small child, he would pick up a broom and pretend to be playing guitar for the entertainment of family guests.

Admission for guests with special needs is free, and fees for the general public are set at a much discounted price so that people of all ages and abilities can come together and play in a fun and safe environment.
The cook sliced some potatoes thinner than before and prepared them for the complaining guest.

definition.en_def: A person who is invited to visit or stay in someone's home or a place.
definition.example: We have a guest staying with us for the weekend.
